com.conichi.utils.observable

Class ViewActions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.conichi.utils.observable.ViewActions

  • public final class ViewActions
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for the Action interfaces for use with views.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <any> setActivated(android.view.View view)
      Create an action which controls the supplied view's activated property.

    • Method Detail

      • setEnabled

        public static <any> setEnabled(android.view.View view)
        Create an action which controls the supplied view's enabled property.

        Note: the created action will not keep a strong reference to the view.

      • setActivated

        public static <any> setActivated(android.view.View view)
        Create an action which controls the supplied view's activated property.

        Note: the created action will not keep a strong reference to the view.

      • setClickable

        public static <any> setClickable(android.view.View view)
        Create an action which controls the supplied view's clickable property.

        Note: the created action will not keep a strong reference to the view.

      • setFocusable

        public static <any> setFocusable(android.view.View view)
        Create an action which controls the supplied view's focusable property.

        Note: the created action will not keep a strong reference to the view.

      • setSelected

        public static <any> setSelected(android.view.View view)
        Create an action which controls the supplied view's selected property.

        Note: the created action will not keep a strong reference to the view.

      • setVisibility

        public static <any> setVisibility(android.view.View view)
        Create an action which controls the supplied view's visibility property. true values are mapped to View.VISIBLE and false values to View.GONE.

        Note: the created action will not keep a strong reference to the view.

        See Also:
        setVisibility(View, int)

      • setVisibility

        public static <any> setVisibility(android.view.View view,
                                  int visibilityOnFalse)
        Create an action which controls the supplied view's visibility property. true values are mapped to View.VISIBLE and false values to the supplied visibility.

        Note: the created action will not keep a strong reference to the view.

        Parameters:
        visibilityOnFalse - View.INVISIBLE or View.GONE.
        See Also:
        setVisibility(View, int)

      • setText

        public static <any> setText(android.widget.TextView textView)
        Create an action which controls the supplied view's text property.

        Note: the created action will not keep a strong reference to the view.

        See Also:
        setTextResource(android.widget.TextView)

      • setTextResource

        public static <any> setTextResource(android.widget.TextView textView)
        Create an action which controls the supplied view's text property.

        Note: the created action will not keep a strong reference to the view.

        See Also:
        setText(android.widget.TextView)
